title: Aural set, jazz ensemble - opening rhythm

content.question: The opening jazz rhythm would be notated as

choices.label: The time signature of each line is four four time and each shows two measures. The rhythm in measure 1 of option A is: eighth, quarter, eighth tied to an eighth, quarter, and eighth with a tie to the next measure. The rhythm in measure 2 of A is: eighth tied from last measure, dotted quarter, eighth, eighth, eighth, and eighth.

The time signature of each line is four four time and each shows two measures. The rhythm in measure 1 of option B is: eighth, quarter, eighth tied to an eighth, quarter, and an eighth with a tie to the next measure. The rhythm in measure 2 of B is: eighth tied from last measure, eighth, eighth, eighth, eighth, eighth, eighth, and eighth.

The time signature of each line is four four time and each shows two measures. The rhythm in measure 1 of option C is: eighth, eighth tied to an eighth, eighth, quarter, and an eighth with a tie to the next measure. The rhythm in measure 2 of C is: eighth tied from last measure, quarter, eighth, eighth, eighth, eighth, and eighth.

The time signature of each line is four four time and each shows two measures. The rhythm in measure 1 of option D is: eighth, eighth tied to an eighth, eighth, quarter, and an eighth with a tie to the next measure. The rhythm in measure 2 of D is: eighth tied from last measure, dotted quarter, eighth, eighth, eighth, and eighth.

content.answer: The time signature of each line is four four time and each shows two measures. The rhythm in measure 1 of option A is: eighth, quarter, eighth tied to an eighth, quarter, and eighth with a tie to the next measure. The rhythm in measure 2 of A is: eighth tied from last measure, dotted quarter, eighth, eighth, eighth, and eighth.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
